channel.title: About on Jan-Philipp Fränken
channel.description: Recent content in About on Jan-Philipp Fränken

item.title: About
item.description: Short Bio I am a 2nd-year PhD Student at The University of Edinburgh where I work with Neil Bramley. I am broadly interested in both natural and artificial intelligence. Currently, my PhD focuses on program induction (specifically, hypothesis adaptation) and probabilistic and causal reasoning in social networks. To study my research questions, I use computational and agent-based models and run online multi-player experiments using MTurk or Prolific. My PhD is funded by the German Academic Scholarship Foundation.

item.title: Contact
